content: This popular board game, invented by Alfred Mosher Butts during the Great Depression, involves creating words on a grid using lettered tiles.

You're referring to Scrabble, a classic word game where players use lettered tiles to form words on a game board divided into a grid. Each letter tile has a point value based on its frequency in the English language, and players aim to score points by forming words horizontally or vertically adjacent to existing words on the board. The game was indeed invented by Alfred Mosher Butts during the Great Depression, and it has since become a beloved pastime for millions around the world.
